channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Green garden/ food waste bins, 20th June
item.description:
We have had 2 green food waste bins removed from the street as they were half full, not emptied in months. They were cracked and juices flowing all over the street. The smell is absolutely rancid and the whole street smells. I have personally poured 2 bottles of bleach on the affected areas and it has made zero difference. The smell is making its way into the houses and it is not fair that we should have to live like it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coupland Place, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Need for a toilet Camberwell Green, 20th June
item.description:
Hello, the problem of people peeing in public is recently getting quite bad. On a 10-minute walk around Camberwell, I saw 3 people urinating on walls. This is not great for the area. There used to be a public toilet on the corner of the Green but it's been removed. Could we consider replacing it, or putting a pop-up urinal somewhere please? I don't like it when people come into my estate to pee against the walls, as you can probably imagine! Thank you,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell Green, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown weeds/trees/bushes, 20th June
item.description:
Over grown trees/bushes/weeds, making it impossible to walk on the pavemnet. making people walk in the road wghere cars and lorrys drive. very dangerous. Today i nearly got hit by a car!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thomas Road, North End, London

item.title: Overgrown vegetation, 20th June
item.description:

item.title: Horse in field, 20th June
item.description:
There is a horse that has been left in the field by the side of Crayford way, there is no water there and resident is concerned if it should be there, he has contacted 101 and they advised that this isnt an issue but he believes it is, could this be looked into please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thames Road, Barnes Cray, London

item.title: Large faeces, probably human, 20th June
item.description:

item.title: More rubbish left here, 20th June
item.description:

item.title: Road closure sign, 20th June
item.description:

item.title: Dead crow or similar in the alleyway to the station, 20th June
item.description:
There's what looks like a freshly dead black bird, probably a crow, in the alleyway between Crayford Road and Station Road. It's not an obstruction as such but it'll probably rot quite quickly on this heat and attract vermin.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, lots of rubbish including food waste, dirty nappies, this is getting bigger, 20th June
item.description:
